result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R Klicpera

records.addlTxt: Jury trial - 12 person on January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John R Klicpera appeared by phone.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for John R Klicpera. 
Defendant is requesting a Jury Trial. Court grants and this matter will be set for trial. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial on July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John R Klicpera in court.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for John R Klicpera. 
Officer Iverson is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer with the City of Marshfield's Police Department. Testifies to being aware of an incident that Officer Berg was involved with. Testifies to statements that HSC made to Officer Berg in regards to what happened with this incident. Testifies to what HSC found at the residence that gives her concern. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to the defendant denying the pipe being his. Testifies to the defendant taking a buccal swab. Testifies to sending the buccal swab and paraphernalia to the state lab and the results.
Attorney Vruwink cross examines the witness. Witness testifies to HSC bringing the pipe into the police station and details of the results of the substance in the pipe. 
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court appoints Attorney Aaron Vruwink as counsel - Defendant must pay the same amount as case# 21CM609
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on April 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:56 AM Defendant John R Klicpera in court.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for John R Klicpera. 
This matter will be reset to get Attorney Vruwink appointed to the case. Defendant waives time limits.
Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 25, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
9:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant John R Klicpera appeared in court.
